subject: History
title: The Iron Curtain Falls
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Iron Curtain Falls.

hook.text: The allies who won WWII together split the world in twoâ€”and stared at each other through nuclear weapons for 45 years.

buildup.text: At war's end, Soviet troops occupied Eastern Europe. Stalin installed communist governments and refused free elections.

discovery.text: Churchill warned in 1946: 'An iron curtain has descended across the continent.' The Cold War had begun.

twist.text: Germany itself was split in two: democratic West and communist East, divided by a wall through its capital city.

climax.text: The Cold War lasted until 1991â€”a 45-year standoff with enough nuclear weapons to destroy civilization several times.

punchline.text: The war against fascism ended. The war against communism began.

quiz.question: What did Churchill mean by the 'iron curtain'?
options: A physical wall built around Berlin
The political and ideological division between Soviet-controlled Eastern Europe and the West
A trade embargo between Europe and Asia
